definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near

sentences.chinese: 那项建议当即遭到拒绝。

sentences.english: One of the jurors immediately declares himself in favour of the utmost rigour of the law being applied to the young woman.
sentences.chinese: 有一名陪审员当即宣布希望能用最严厉的法律制裁她。

sentences.english: Bishamber had now come back to Calcutta, and had at once made enquiries about his sister.
sentences.chinese: 比山博现在来了加尔各答，当即询问关于妹妹的境况。

sentences.english: A boy was run over by a truck and got killed immediately.
sentences.chinese: 一个男孩被一辆卡车从身上压过去，当即死亡。

sentences.english: She had made these remarks offhandedly.
Boyle threw open the door of the truck and started running after the car.
sentences.chinese: 博伊尔当即甩开卡车的门朝那辆雪佛兰跑去。

sentences.english: Qian Manyuan immediately went to the piano, but found that Chunan and Kotoko snuggle.
sentences.chinese: 钱曼媛当即去找琴子，却发现曾楚南与琴子紧紧依偎。

sentences.english: Chances are he'd have beaten himself to death with his own guitar right there and then.
sentences.chinese: 很可能他会当即当场用自己的吉他把自己敲死。

sentences.english: Agassiz immediately began to question him to find out what he knew.
sentences.chinese: 阿加西当即向他开始提问，想了解他都知道些什么。

sentences.english: The highly anticipated dates sold out almost immediately when tickets went on sale.
sentences.chinese: 当备受等候的售票日起头时，门票几乎当即发卖一空。

sentences.english: They immediately made a decision to order a 4-color shuttle pad printer from KCPM.
sentences.chinese: 客人当即签约定购四色穿梭移印机一台。

sentences.english: Ming is concussed and goes to hospital.
sentences.chinese: 明当即昏迷，被送往医院。

sentences.english: She answered me like the obtuse child she decided I was.
sentences.chinese: 她当即觉得我愚钝不可教，但还是回答了我。

sentences.english: Xiuxiu called him back, but Guo was too frightened and could only say sorry.
sentences.chinese: 秀秀当即叫住他，郭排军吓的只知道说“对不起”。

sentences.english: Dacheng immediately decided to steal the money to gamble.
sentences.chinese: 大成当即决定偷拿这笔钱去赌博。

sentences.english: Nosering, think the price is too high, serve immediately go three people.
sentences.chinese: 老管家认为价钱太高，当即要轰走三人。

definition: not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
in a great rush/in a flurry
see 二話不說|二话不说[er4 hua4 bu4 shuo1]
